definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.chinese: 谁是第一个反对“地心说”的人？

sentences.english: Ptolemy's geocentric theory has been taken as an example of a paradigm.
sentences.chinese: 托勒密的地心说已被认为是一个范式例子。

sentences.english: I wanna you take my hands, and say you love, with you heart sincerely.
sentences.chinese: 我想要你牵起我的手，用你真诚地心说出爱我。

sentences.english: Today, we all know that this "earth center theory" is wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天都知道“地心说”是错误的。

definition: heliocentric theory/the theory that the sun is at the center of the universe
Mikolaj Kopernik or Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543), Polish astronomer, mathematician and polymath
geocentric theory in ancient Chinese astronomy

Ptolemy, kings of Egypt after the partition of Alexander the Great's Empire in 305 BC/Ptolemy or Claudius Ptolemaeus (c. 90-c. 168), Alexandrian Greek astronomer, mathematician and geographer, author of the Almagest 天文學大成|天文学大成/see also 托勒玫[Tuo1 le4 mei2]
René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
Leibniz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
